metadata.title: CVE-2018-16476 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
A Broken Access Control vulnerability in Active Job versions >= 4.2.0allows an attacker to craft user input which can cause Active Job todeserialize it using GlobalId and give them access to information that theyshould not have. This vulnerability has been fixed in versions 4.2.11,5.0.7.1, 5.1.6.1, and 5.2.1.1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-16476` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

rails - 2:6.1.7+dfsg-1
ruby-actioncable - 2:6.1.7+dfsg-1
ruby-actionmailbox - 2:6.1.7+dfsg-1
ruby-actionmailer - 2:6.1.7+dfsg-1
ruby-actionpack - 2:6.1.7+dfsg-1
ruby-actiontext - 2:6.1.7+dfsg-1
ruby-actionview - 2:6.1.7+dfsg-1
ruby-activejob - 2:6.1.7+dfsg-1
ruby-activemodel - 2:6.1.7+dfsg-1
ruby-activerecord - 2:6.1.7+dfsg-1
ruby-activestorage - 2:6.1.7+dfsg-1
ruby-activesupport - 2:6.1.7+dfsg-1
ruby-rails - 2:6.1.7+dfsg-1
ruby-railties - 2:6.1.7+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: rails package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:6.1.7+dfsg-1').
